thesis.description: Cette thèse a permis la réalisation d'un matériau béton entièrement dérivé de déchets. Ceci a été possible grâce à l'emploi de déchets industriels et de dioxyde de carbone. Les agrégats et le ciment composant ce béton vert ont été artificiellement conçus à partir de résidus de déchets provenant des procédés de fabrication de l'acier pour les granulats et d'incinération des déchets pour le ciment. La sélection de ces déchets s'est basée sur leur abondance, leur composition intéressante pour le projet, et leur finesse à leur réception. La carbonatation a été effectuée successivement à travers différentes étapes de traitement, dans le but de générer des matériaux résistants et de transformer le CO2 gazeux en carbonates solides. Des agrégats angulaires de différentes tailles (permettant une granulométrie efficace pour le béton) ont été générés par carbonatation de scories d'aciérie. Ces agrégats ont été analysés et sont principalement composés de polymorphes de silicate di-calcique β et γ. Après un traitement optimal, les agrégats ressemblaient à un matériau monolithe très résistant, de type céramique. La carbonatation des scories d'acier a généré une pâte durcie de C-S-H/CaCO3, où le C-S-H formait la matrice de liaison tandis que les précipités de nano-CaCO3 agissait comme le composite de renforcement.De plus, le ciment dérivé des déchets a été produit à partir d'un mélange stœchiométrique de cendres volantes d'incinération et de déchets d'hydrate de calcium chauffé à 1000°C. Les principales phases du clinker réactif générées étaient le silicate chloro-ellestadite et le silicate di-calcique β. Ce liant n'avait pas de comportement hydraulique mais s'est efficacement consolidé lors de l'activation par carbonatation, formant une matrice de liaison composée de gypse, C-S-H et CaCO3. Le béton vert finalement obtenu en combinant les deux composants stables dérivés de déchets démontre des performances comparables au béton commercial de référence. La béton ainsi produit ne consomme pas de ressources naturelles et pourrait potentiellement séquestrer jusqu'à 12,6 millions de tonnes de CO2 par an si les industries de blocs de maçonnerie aux États-Unis et au Canada adoptaient les méthodes prescrites.

This thesis work successfully demonstrated the attainment of a fully waste-derived concrete material through the employment of industrial wastes and carbon dioxide. The aggregate and cement components of this green concrete were artificially synthesized from waste residues originating from the steelmaking and waste-incineration processes, respectively. The selection of these waste materials was based on their convenient abundance, compositional suitability, and as-received fineness. Carbonation was carried out successively through different stages of processing for the purpose of activating strength and converting gaseous CO2 into solid carbonates. Graded angular aggregates were generated from the carbonation of steelmaking slag, which was found to be composed mainly of β and γ di-calcium silicate polymorphs. After optimum processing, the aggregates resembled a very resilient, ceramic-like monolith material. Carbonation of steel slag generated a hardened C-S-H/CaCO3 paste, where C-S-H formed the binding medium while the nano-CaCO3 precipitates acted as the reinforcing composite. Additionally, waste-derived cement was produced from a stoichiometric mix of incinerator fly ash and waste-lime at 1000°C. The main reactive clinker phases generated were chloro-ellestadite and β di-calcium silicate. This binder did not possess hydraulic behaviour but effectively consolidated upon carbonation activation, forming a binding matrix comprised of gypsum, C-S-H, and CaCO3. The final green concrete product obtained from combining the two stable waste-derived components was comparable in performance to commercial benchmark concrete. Concrete so produced consumes no natural resources and can hypothetically sequester up to 12.6 million tons of CO2 per year if the Masonry block industries in United States and Canada were to adopt the prescribed methodologies.
thesis.creator: Al-Ghouleh, Zaid
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics
thesis.title: Development of green concrete from industrial wastes and carbon dioxide
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Doctor of Philosophy
degree.discipline: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics

thesis.description: This thesis presents a comprehensive numerical method for determining the current distribution on complex wire antennas. Various individual improvements suggested separately in the literature are extended and developed further, and then are combined with a reformulated junction constraint into an amalgamated whole. Thus: (i) The current is represented with subdomain basis functions such that its derivative (the charge density) is continuous; (ii) POint-matching is replaced by a method named herein "average field matching", This method was developed to extend the application of the finite difference approximation in the derivative term in Pocklington's Equation, such that a large step size can be used rigorously for general three dimensional structures; (iii) Special attention is given to the accurate evaluation of the field integral and the test integral; (iv) The reduced kernel is made more precise by modifying it to use the exact distance between the source point and the observation point; (v) It is shown that a current generator source possesses a significant advantage over excitation by an applied electric field; and (vi) A complete multiple wire junction constraint is used, in which the charge density is made equal on each wire at the junction point, while simultaneously enforcing KCL at the junction. [...]

Cette thèse présente une méthode approfondie qui permet de déterminer la distribution du courant dans des brins d'antenne. Plusieurs améliorations suggérées dans la littérature sont développées et élargies, puis combinées et unifiées en tenant compte d'une contrainte nouvelle au point de jonction. Ainsi: (i) Le courant est représenté par des fonctions de base dont les dérivées (la densité de la charge) sont des fonctions continues; (ii) La méthode d'interpolation ponctuelle est remplacée par une méthode appelée ici "interpolation du champ moyen". On a élaboré cette méthode afin de pouvoir app1iquer l'approximation aux différences finies de la dérivée dans l'équation de Pocklington, et de permettre l'utilisation rigoureuse d'incréments 1arges a des structures générales a trois dimensions; (iii) On a analysé particulièrement la précision de l'évaluation de l'intégrale de champ et de l'intégrale du produit scalaire; (iv) On a obtenu une valeur plus précise du noyau en le modifiant de telle manière a pouvoir utiliser la distance exacte entre la source et le point d'observation; (v) On montre qu'une source de courant possède un avantage significatif sur une source consistant a appliquer un champ électrique; et (vi) On utilise une contrainte nouvelle a la jonction des brins d'antenne, selon laquelle la densité de charge sur chaque brin est la même au point de jonction, tout en conservant la condition du KCL a la jonction.[...]
thesis.creator: Trueman, Christopher W.
thesis.subject: Electrical engineering
thesis.title: Average field matching wire antenna moment method and aircraft HF antenna application

thesis.description: Ce travail est un pas en avant sur la route de la classification des singularités dans le contexte de la Geometric Différentielle Synthétique. On utilise une version interne de la topologic des Compacts-Ouverts de C"(V, R) qui se révéle practique a l'heure de prouver des resultats de densité (l'aspect genérique). Avec cette topologie on montre comment diverses notions de stabilité peuvent etre intemalissées et comparées. Les singularités sont étudiees ici pour les gennes syntbétiques (representés par des objects infinitésimals) car cette propieté appartienne au "tout pres" du point. On obtient le resultat de characterisation suivant: les germes stables de fontions sur R sont exactement les germes de Morse. Ce "batiment" a pour piliers le Théoreme de Preparation de Malgrange et le théorème de Densité des valeurs regulières de Sard. D'ailleurs, la pierre clef est la méthode homotopique de Thom. Tout les trois ont été valides dans le topos de Dubuc, le modèle de test.

In this work, we initiate the classification of singularities in the framework of Synthetic Differential Geometry; as in the classical setting, we restrict ourselves to the study of the stable mappings. To this end, we use an internalization of the classical Compact-Open topology of C-(M, R), particularly useful to show density results (genericy aspect). Using this topology we present and compare the internal versions of several notions of stability. Singularities, being a property of the "very near" to the point, are studied here using infinitesimally represented synthetic germs. We obtain a characterization of stable germs of functions in the synthetic context as being those with only non-degenerate singularities: Morsegerms The whole "building" has two cornerstones: Weierstrass' Preparation Theorem, and Sard's Density of Regular Values Theorem. On the other hand, the keystone is Thorn's Homotopy Method. The three of them are shown to be valid in our test model: the topos of Dubuc.
thesis.creator: Gago, Felipe
thesis.subject: Mathematics
thesis.title: Internal weak opens, internal stability and morse theory for synthetic germs
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A large number of addition complexes formed between acceptor molecules containing Group IIIA elements and nitrogen donors are reported in the chemical literature, and with few exceptions (e.g., ethylenediamine), the donor molecules have contained only one nitrogen atom. It was therefore of particular interest to investigate the reactions of some "electron-deficient" molecules of Group IIIIA elements with hydrazine, the simplest substance having two nitrogen atoms which are potential electron donors.[...]

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The reactions of some Lewis acids with hydrazine.

thesis.description: We have investigated linguistic structure to find a grammar that will generate all sentences in English and only those. We pointed out that no finitie-state Markov process can serve as our grammar.We also pointed out that phrase structure, per se, is also inadequate but may serve as a kernel for transformational grammars. This, of course, leads to a complexity of obligatory and optional rules. We then introduced syntactic categories built up by the notion of rules of meaning and two basic categories -name (n) and sentence (s). We then built up syntactic types for English structures and described three methods of derivation for generating sentences. The first depended upon the order of functors and arguments; the second method of derivation, through categories of types, permitted operations on the left and on the right; the third, after introducing a set of axiom schemes, rules of inference, produced a decision procedure based upon Gentzen's theorem.[...]
thesis.creator: Bedford, Frederick W.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: The arithmetics of linguistic structures.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It has been frequently observed that wide individual differences exist in what Wolff and Hardy have calles the reaction to pain. However cases, in which the usual behavioral and physiological responses to noxious stimili are apparently totally absent, are rare and strange enough to have aroused considerable scientific interest. Many of these cases not only exhibit absence of reaction to pain, but through verbal report have led investigators to infer that the direct perceptual experience of usually painful stimli os ,arkedly different from normal.[...]
thesis.creator: McMurray, Gordon A.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Psychology and physiology of pain.

thesis.description: In April, 1959, the Commonwealth Parliament enacted an Act, the Civil Aviation (Carriers• Liability) ( 1) Act 1959. This Act deals with international carriage by air and carriage by air within Australia. It made far reaching and perhaps revolutionary changes to the law of carriage by air within Australia. This thesis was written for the purpose of describihi those changes and their effect and to describe the law applying to carriage by air which is not covered by the Act. [...]
thesis.creator: Bradley, Martin A.
thesis.subject: Liability for aircraft accidents.
Aeronautics, Commercial -- Law and legislation -- Australia.
thesis.title: Air carrier’s liability in Australia

thesis.description: Die Suche nach dem neuen Menschen ist ein Hauptmerklllal des expressionistischen Verkündigungsdramas. In der bisherigen Forschung wird sie of't nur im Zusammenhang mit der Aufbruchstimmung der revolutionaren expressionistischen Dichtergeneration betrachtet. Die hier vorgelegte Arbeit hingegen führt über das expressionistische Jahrzehnt hinaus.[...] Bei Serge führt die Suche nach dem neuen Menschen über Nietzsche zur christlichen Religion, bei Kaiser zu einer Kette von Experimenten nrit immer neuen Losungen, bei Toller zum Konflikt zwischen dem idealistischen Weltverbesserungsglauben und konsequentem politischen Handeln, bei Johst zum Nationalsozialismus und bei Brecht zum Kommunismus. Wahrend man bisher zumeist annarun, dass die expressionistischen Dramatiker nicht über 11Suche" und "Verkündigungrr hinausgelangt seien, beweist diese Arbeit, dass einige von ihnen doch zu ganz konkreten Schlüssen gekornmen sind, sofern man ihr Werk nicht nur im engen Rahmen des expressionistischen Jahrzehnts betrachtet.
thesis.creator: Riedel, Walter E.
thesis.subject: German drama -- History and criticism
thesis.title: Studien zum neuen Menschen im deutschen Drama des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A radiometric survey of Redwater Oilfield was carried out during the summer of 1956. The field work included collections of 450 radon samples, 4000 total count determinations, and collections of 865 soil samples for analysis from 200 holes, 5 feet deep, drilled approximately 1300 feet apart. During the course of the field season it was observed that radiation measured at the surface of earth or just above it comes from within 0-0. 3 feet in loams, 0. 6 = 1. 5 feet in sands, and about 2 feet in peat. It was also noticed that the radon content was lower in holes drilled on top of the sand dunes and near the road cuts in comparison with the holes drilled on the sides away from the road cuts. [...] The results suggest an anomalous low associated with the Ten Section pool and a high with the L'Assomption prospect. Several faults have been inferred from the radium data in L'Assomption Area.IXA mechanism to explain the existence of radiometric anomalies due to the possible presence of fractures in the rocks through which water and hydrocarbons may migrate is proposed. Because one can delineate fault and fracture systems through rivers, muskegs and swamps with radium data, it is therefore considered that radium data is superior to total count data. It is concluded that the airborne gamma ray spectrometer may be very useful in locating oil and water bearing areas, fault and fracture systems, and probably many mineral deposits.
thesis.creator: Sikka, Deshbandhu
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: A Radiometric survey of Redwater Oilfield Alberta, Canada
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Music is an art expressed through the presentation of successivetenporal spans. '!he resulting patterns create form.Tatporal spans may be articulated by arrj perceptual change in themusical fabric. In Structures: Phase/TiIrbre divisions are expressed bychanges in texture, density, timbre, register, ha:rnony, and dynamics.'!he structures created by the tenporal spans, or P'lases, arepatterned on a nodel of tinbre. Tinbre is the result of many aoousticalIilenonena., one of which is the overtones present in a sound. 'Iheseovertones create divisions expressed by the related periods of theirrespective cycles.Although the cycles of the overtones are aurally inperceivable, thepatterns which they create are retained when the durations of the periodsare increased. '!hese patterns are the basis of the fonnal organizationof Structures: Phase/Tinbre.

La musique est un art qui exprime des suite~ de sons de duree variable. La forme nait des agencements ainsi prod~its. Les durees peuvent etre articu1ees par n'importe que11e modification perceptible du tissu musical. Dans Structures: Phase/Timbre, ces divisions sont exprimes par 1es changements de texture, de densite, de timbre, de registre, et de dynamique. Les structures qui sont creeespar 1es durees (ou phases) sont constriuites sur un mode1e de timbre. Le timbre est le resu1tat de p1usieurs phenomenes acoustiques, dont l'un constitue 1es partie1s presents dans un son. Ces partie1s creent des divisions qui sont exprimees par 1es periodes de 1eur cycles respectifs. Bien que 1es cycles des partie1s soient imperceptib1es a l'orei11e, 1es agencements qui sont crees par 1es cycles ne sont pas modifies lorsqu'on augmente la duree des periodes. Ces agencements sont la base de l'organisation forme11e de Structures: Phase/Timbre.
thesis.creator: Savage, Roger W. H.
thesis.subject: Music
thesis.title: An Analysis of structures : Phase/Timbre.

thesis.description: The purpose of this thesis is to analyze my piece for orchestra and chorus, Apokalypsis, which was written in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree of Doctor of Music in Composition. An attempt will be made to present a complete analysis of the pitch and rhythmic structures, as well as important orchestration procedures, and to formulate a method of analyzing music that integrates elements of-both "fUnctional" and "non-functional" tonality.

L'objet de cette these est d'analyser mon oeuvre pour orchestre et choeur, Apokalypsis, qui etait ecrite en execution partielle des exigences du grade de Docteur en musique en composition. Un essai sera fait de presenter tous les pOints d'importance concernant les tons, les rhythmes et l'orchestration de l'oeuvre et de formuler un moyen d'analyser la musique dans laquelle il y a une integration des passages de tonalite "fonctionnelle" et "non-fonctionnelle".

thesis.title: An Analysis of Apokalysis for Orchestra and Chorus.

thesis.description: The history of urinary calculi dates back many thousands of years when their occurrence was quite marked; as living conditions have become better, and people have beaome healthier, their frequency has decreased. The earliest listed publication describing urinary calculi dates back to 1614 when Untzerus published, in Latin, a treatise on stones. In 1739, all ofEngland was in an uproar because an Englishwoman claimed to have concocted a cure for kidney stones. Her formula included the use of dried birds' eggs and soap. [...]

thesis.title: The chemical composition of urinary calculi and itssignificance.

thesis.description: Tetraphenylcyclopentadienone can be used as one of the components in the diene synthesis. Products are described resulting from the addition of maleic anhydride, maleic, fumaric, and acetylene dicarboxylic esters, and benzoyl phenylacetylene. In some instances the primary addition products containing a carbonyl bridge (hexendones) could be isolated. Tetraphenylbenzene derivatives result from secondary reactions. Neither benzalacetophenone, dibenzoylethylene nor diphenylketene added to tetraphenylcyclopentadlenone. [...]

thesis.description: Manganese oxide compounds prepared in different ways adsorb protactinium with different efficiencies. X-ray analysis of these types shows a rough correlation between crystal structure and adsorption efficiency. Careful experiments on protactinium adsorption were carried out on four widely different crystal forms, including pyrolucite and cryptomelane. The adsorption efficiencies of these types were correlated semi-quantitatively with the surface areas of these powdered compounds as viewed in the electron microscope. [...]

thesis.description: One of the greatest problems of the present day in the coal industry is the utilization of coals which a few years ago were of practically of no value on account of their Sulphur and Ash content. The importance of this problem has not been realized to the same extent on the North American Continent as in the older and more fully developed countries of the Old World such as Germany, England, France and Austria. Here, on this side of the Atlantic we are extremely fortunate in being the possessors of enormous areas of bituminous coal lands, and in earlier years we have been content to mine only the pick of these. [...]
